actions.committee: House Committee on Banking and Financial Services
actions.text: Referred to the House Committee on Banking and Financial Services.

actions.in_committee: House Committee on Banking and Financial Services
actions.text: Referred to the Subcommittee on Domestic and International Monetary Policy.

committees.subcommittee: Subcommittee on Domestic and International Monetary Policy

official_title: To ban the provision of Federal funds to the International Monetary Fund unless it pays remuneration to the United States on 100 percent of the reserve position of the United States in the International Monetary Fund.

summary.text: Prohibits any U.S. officer, employee, or agent from providing or approving the provision of any resources to the International Monetary Fund (IMF) through gold sales, an increase in the U.S. quota in the IMF, or any other means, unless the Secretary of the Treasury determines that the IMF pays remuneration to the United States on 100 percent of the reserve position of the United States in the IMF.

titles.title: To ban the provision of Federal funds to the International Monetary Fund unless it pays remuneration to the United States on 100 percent of the reserve position of the United States in the International Monetary Fund.
